oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Andrew Jackson equestrian statue at Tennessee State Capitol Building, 1953
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pictured: the Clark Mills equestrian bronze statue of General Andrew Jackson at the Battle of New Orleans. It is one of the three identical statues sculpted by the artist. This statue stands upon the front lawn to the Tennessee State Capitol Building in downtown Nashville. The other two statues are at New Orleans, Louisiana and Washington, D. C. It is the first design of a person on horseback ever cast in the United States. The monument was dedicated during Nashville’s centennial celebration in May 1880. Forms part of Record Group 3, Metro Davidson County Photographer. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
